# My Third Post

Hey guys! I just wanted to show you the Lollipop Chart I made for our quarto, code, and r assignment! From the ggplot examples, I chose the lollipop chart. Here is the link: [Lollipop Chart Link](https://r-statistics.co/Top50-Ggplot2-Visualizations-MasterList-R-Code.html#Lollipop%20Chart)

```{r}
#| code-fold: true
#| code-summary: "Show the code"

library(ggplot2)
theme_set(theme_bw())


cty_mpg <- data.frame(
  make = c("Chevrolet", "Audi", "Toyota", "Honda"),
  mileage = c(15, 17.5, 18, 24)
)

ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x = make, y = mileage)) + 
  geom_point(size = 3) + 
  geom_segment(aes(x = make,
                   xend = make,
                   y = 0,
                   yend = mileage)) + 
  labs(title = "Lollipop Chart", 
       subtitle = "Make Vs Avg. Mileage", 
       caption = "source: mpg") + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 65, vjust = 0.6))
```
